==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=大将军|type=12}}
{{wikipedia|lang=zh}}

===Etymology===
An official position which came into being during the {{w|Warring States Period}}, and reached the zenith of its influence during the {{w|Han dynasty}}. At first, the person in this position was the supreme military commander (modern equivalent ~ {{w|Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff}}). During the later half of the Han dynasty, he also took over the day to day executive affairs of government (modern equivalent ~ {{w|Hideki Tojo}}). During the {{w|Three Kingdoms}} period, the position again became military related (modern equivalent ~ {{w|United States Secretary of Defense}}).
